entities.paths

Class DP_State_Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.paths.DP_State_Node

  • public class DP_State_Node
extends Object
    A state-node in the multi-stage DP graph constructed by DP_Problem_Instance.bottom_up(). Each state contains local information specific to the problem. For example, in join problems states represent database tuples.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      DP_DecisionSet decisions
      All the decisions that can be made at this state.
      private double opt_cost
      The minimum achievable cost starting from this node.
      Object state_info
      Holds local information about the state, depends on the DP problem.
      boolean terminal
      A flag that indicates whether this node is part of the last stage of DP.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DP_State_Node(Object info)
      Creates a new DP state.

    • Field Detail

      • terminal

        public boolean terminal
        A flag that indicates whether this node is part of the last stage of DP.

      • decisions

        public DP_DecisionSet decisions
        All the decisions that can be made at this state.

      • opt_cost

        private double opt_cost
        The minimum achievable cost starting from this node.

      • state_info

        public Object state_info
        Holds local information about the state, depends on the DP problem.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DP_State_Node

        public DP_State_Node(Object info)
        Creates a new DP state. Initially, we don't know the possible decisions and there is no way to reach the final state. Thus, the optimal cost is infinite.
        Parameters:
        info - Local state information.

    • Method Detail

      • add_decision

        public void add_decision(DP_State_Node resulting_state,
                         double immediate_cost)
        Adds a decision to the pool of possible ones from this node. This decision incurs some immediate cost given as parameter. If we follow the new decision from this state, we end up in resulting_state.
        Parameters:
        resulting_state - The state we end up if we follow the new edge-decision.
        immediate_cost - The cost we have to pay to follow the new edge-decision.

      • share_decisions

        public void share_decisions(DP_State_Node other_state)
        Makes this state share the same decisions with another state. Useful e.g. for the equi-join when tuples share the same join values. Use only after the other state has finished adding decisions.
        Parameters:
        other_state - The state whose decisions will be copied to this one.

      • get_best_child

        public DP_State_Node get_best_child()
        Returns the best child (state-node) we can hop to from the current state-node.
        Returns:
        DP_State_Node The child that incurs the minimum achievable cost.

      • get_best_decision

        public DP_Decision get_best_decision()
        Returns:
        DP_Decision The best available decision from this state.

      • get_decisions

        public ArrayList<DP_Decision> get_decisions()
        Returns:
        ArrayList The decisions that can be made from this state and can lead to the terminal state.

      • get_opt_cost

        public double get_opt_cost()
        Returns:
        double The minimum achievable cost starting from this state.

      • set_opt_cost

        public void set_opt_cost(double opt_cost)
        Parameters:
        opt_cost - The minimum achievable cost starting from this state.

      • set_to_terminal

        public void set_to_terminal()
        Sets the minimum achievable cost from this node to 0.

      • is_terminal

        public boolean is_terminal()
        Returns:
        boolean True if this node is part of the last stage of DP, False otherwise.

      • get_number_of_children

        public int get_number_of_children()
        Returns:
        int The number of nodes that this node reaches in 1-hop.

      • get_children

        public ArrayList<DP_State_Node> get_children()
        CAUTION: expensive because it allocates a new list.
        Returns:
        ArrayList The children that are capable of reaching the terminal state.

      • toTuple

        public Tuple toTuple()
        Returns the tuple that is contained inside the node. Only works for state-nodes that correspond to database tuples, will fail otherwise.
        Returns:
        Tuple The corresponding database tuple.

      • get_decision_cost

        public double get_decision_cost(DP_State_Node child)
        CAUTION: expensive operation, use only for debugging.
        Parameters:
        child - One of the children of this node.
        Returns:
        double The cost of a decision that leads to the specified child.
        If there is no such feasible decision, returns infinity.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String
